In response, an independent group called Anti AII (Artificial Intelligence Industry) emerges, with the aim of liberating humanity from the manipulative influence of these mega-corporations through authentic art, which enriches creators and observers without having any commercial value like art driven by capitalism.
What will you do to protect your rights and maintain your individuality in an AI world that seems like a bad science fiction joke?

6. Dune: Inspired by "Dune" by Frank Herbert

In a bleak future, Earth has been transformed into a dry and sterile wasteland, the result of excessive exploitation of its natural resources. After suffering various natural disasters in the form of destructive flash floods, inundations, hurricanes, and intense cold and heat waves, now, water, which was once abundant, has become the scarcest and most valuable asset, handled with an iron fist by ruthless merchants who control the last reserves of the vital liquid. Cities, now enclaves monopolized by these merchants, rise as fortresses where access to water is the greatest sign of power and wealth. Human greed has led to the drying up of rivers, the reduction of lakes to puddles, and the conversion of oceans into horizons of contaminated water. The exploitation has been so extensive that every drop of water has become a currency in a brutal economy. The lessons of sustainability and respect for the environment have been forgotten, giving way to a culture of scarcity and conflict. In this context, true wealth is no longer measured in precious metals or luxury goods, but in the amount of water one controls. The leaders of this era are the merchants who have built empires on the misery of the thirsty. Humanity is trapped in an endless cycle of exploitation, where water has become the main driver of power and conflict. The vision of a sustainable future vanishes in a panorama of desolation and inequality.
The future is in your hands! What are you going to do now in the face of climate change, denialism, and the exploitation of resources under an extreme neoliberal system?

I cannot ignore that the current system has allowed the development and well-being of millions of people. It's easy to blame capitalism, but hasn't progress been achieved thanks to the exploitation of resources? Maybe not all is lost. Is destroying the system that has brought so many advances, albeit at an environmental cost, really the only solution?

content: You will fight for climate justice, promoting clean energy and sustainable policies to curb the crisis.

Meanwhile, social networks, invaded by endless advertising, have been monopolized by a handful of corporations that decide what is visible and what should remain in the shadows. Privacy is no more than a myth in a world where everything is tracked, recorded, and sold to the highest bidder.
